name: Uniform Cost Search
description: Finds the cheapest-cost path in weighted graphs by expanding the least-cost node first.
when_to_use: Weighted graphs where edge costs vary and you need optimal (cheapest) path
When no heuristic is available but costs matter
Network routing with varying link costs
Any shortest-path problem with non-negative edge weights
when_not_to_use: Unweighted graphs (BFS is simpler and equivalent)
When a good heuristic exists (A* is faster)

complexity.time: O((V + E) log V) with binary heap
complexity.space: O(V) â€” stores all vertices in priority queue

parameters.name: goal_test
parameters.description: Returns true if state is the goal

embedding_text: UCS uniform cost search finds cheapest cost path in weighted graphs. Expands least-cost node first using priority queue. Guarantees optimal path with non-negative edge weights. Use when costs vary and no heuristic available.
